simplesect.para: return a string of the type of the catalog return NULL if an error occured and set the GError correctly

detaileddescription.para: Instance all catalogs for use if it's not the case return the number of catalog available

memberdef.argsstring: (gfal_handle handle, const char *path, int mode, GError **err)
memberdef.name: gfal_catalogs_accessG

detaileddescription.para:
Execute an access function on the first catalog compatible in the catalog list return the result of the first valid catalog for a given URL
result of the access method or -1 if error and set GError with the correct value error : EPROTONOSUPPORT means that the URL is not matched by a catalog

memberdef.argsstring: (gfal_handle handle, const char *path, struct stat *st, GError **err)

memberdef.argsstring: (gfal_handle handle, const char *path, struct stat *st, GError **err)

detaileddescription.para: Execute a lstat function in the lfc

memberdef.argsstring: (gfal_handle handle, const char *path, mode_t mode, gboolean pflag, GError **err)
memberdef.name: gfal_catalog_mkdirp

detaileddescription.para:
Execute a mkdir function on the first compatible catalog ( checked with check url func )
handle
handle of the current context
path
path to create
mode
right of the file created
pflag
if TRUE, execute the request recursively if necessary else work as the common mkdir system call
GError
error report system
no check on the path, please check the path before
return 0 if success else return -1

Execute a opendir function on the first compatible catalog ( checked with check url func )
handle
handle of the current context
path
path to open
GError
error report system
gfal_file_handle pointer given to the handle or NULL if error
close the given dir handle in the proper catalog

memberdef.argsstring: (gfal_handle handle, const char *path, int flag, mode_t mode, GError **err)
memberdef.name: gfal_catalog_openG

detaileddescription.para: open the file specified by path on the proper catalog with the specified flag and mode

memberdef.argsstring: (gfal_handle handle, const char *path, int flag, mode_t mode, GError **err)
memberdef.name: gfal_catalog_open_globalG

detaileddescription.para:
Complete openG func with catalog->surl resolution This func try to resolve the path to a valid surl and open surl with the srm module else open is call on the first compatible catalog like in the normal way.
pointer to file handle if success else NULL if error
close the given file handle in the proper catalog

Resolve a link on the catalog to a list of surl
pointer to a table of string with all the surls, table end with NULL, or return NULL if error
must be free with g_list_free_full

memberdef.argsstring: (catalog_handle, const char *surl, char *buff_turl, int size_turl, GError **err)
